content.summary_of_the_paper: This paper introduces Curriculum Learning, specifically Self-paced Learning, into the physics-informed neural networks (PINNs) learning, so as to train the model from easy samples to hard ones to improve the convergence. The proposed method simple takes the example-wise training loss as Difficulty Measurer to determine which training sample should be used during the training. The effectiveness of the proposed method is verified in a typical parabolic equation and Burgers equation.
content.strength_and_weaknesses:
Strength:
1. The paper focuses on an emerging and important research area, the convergence of PINN.
2. The idea of introducing Self-paced Learning into PINN training is straightforward and interesting.


Weaknesses:
1. The format of the paper seems not ready for ICLR main conference.
2. The idea is too naive and the experimental part is too simple and lacks deep analyses.
3. There are too many typos.
